item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, February 2, 2025 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Recent results show that LLMs struggle with compositional tasks (109 points | 76 comments)
2. CDC orders mass retraction and revision of submitted research (259 points | 114 comments)
3. Apple is open sourcing Swift Build (533 points | 228 comments)
4. RLHF Book (175 points | 17 comments)
5. Pointers Are Complicated II, or: We need better language specs (2020) (70 points | 27 comments)
6. A bookmarklet to kill sticky headers (2013) (137 points | 55 comments)
7. A Rust procedural language handler for PostgreSQL (8 points | discuss)
8. SQL or Death? Seminar Series – Spring 2025 (23 points | 14 comments)
9. I'm Ready for You: On Balzac (3 points | discuss)
10. Bzip3: A spiritual successor to BZip2 (235 points | 137 comments)
11. Python 3, Pygame, and Debian Bookworm on the Miyoo A30 (107 points | 18 comments)
12. String of recent killings linked to Bay Area 'Zizians' (427 points | 550 comments)
13. Enhancing your MIDI devices with Perl (67 points | 6 comments)
14. Visualizing all books of the world in ISBN-Space (367 points | 73 comments)
15. LMD: A new, less wasteful metal 3D printing technique (48 points | 13 comments)
16. The origin and unexpected evolution of the word "mainframe" (76 points | 22 comments)
17. Macrodata Refinement (343 points | 195 comments)
18. A mouseless tale: trying for a keyboard-driven desktop (68 points | 33 comments)
19. Archivists work to save disappearing data.gov datasets (485 points | 143 comments)
20. YouTube audio quality – How good does it get? (2022) (103 points | 58 comments)
21. Engineered waterways helped Ancient Amazonians became master maize farmers (19 points | 1 comment)
22. Avoid ISP Routers (2024) (222 points | 129 comments)
23. 'Obelisks', a new class of life living inside humans (53 points | 11 comments)
24. MindsDB (YC W20) Is Hiring an Office Manager in SF ( | hide)
25. New thermogalvanic tech paves way for more efficient fridges (80 points | 36 comments)
26. Discovery of collagen in fossil bone could unlock new insights into dinosaurs (54 points | 12 comments)
27. Ratzilla (115 points | 25 comments)
28. In Zig, what's a writer? (132 points | 62 comments)
29. Newsstands, 2012-2019 (48 points | 3 comments)
30. OpenAI O3-Mini (913 points | 860 comments)
